item.title: 克罗格起诉美国联邦贸易委员会，称其内部法官违宪
item.description: 克罗格公司（Kroger）周一起诉美国联邦贸易委员会，要求阻止该监管机构审查该食品杂货连锁店与规模较小的竞争对手阿尔伯森公司（Albertsons）价值 250 亿美元的合并提案，称联邦贸易委员会的内部法庭违反宪法。【原文：Kroger sued the U.S. Federal Trade Commission on Monday, seeking to block the regulator from reviewing the grocery chain's proposed $25 billion merger with smaller rival Albertsons , calling the FTC's in-house tribunal unconstitutional.】

item.title: 墨西哥 8 月上半月通胀可能有所缓解
item.description: 路透社周一的一项民意调查显示，墨西哥 8 月上半月的同比通胀率可能有所下降，这为墨西哥央行在下个月的会议上再次下调关键利率提供了支持。【原文：Mexico's year-on-year inflation likely eased in the first half of August, a Reuters poll showed on Monday, bolstering the case for the central bank to cuts its key interest rate again at its meeting next month.】

item.title: Stellantis 公司的 UAW 工人准备提出申诉，并可能举行罢工
item.description: 代表斯泰兰特公司工人的几个美国汽车工人联合会（UAW）工会分会正准备就汽车制造商未能履行投资承诺和与工会签订的合同提出申诉。【原文：Several United Auto Workers (UAW) union locals representing workers at Stellantis are preparing to file grievances over what the labor group claims are the automaker's failure to keep its investment commitments and honor its contract with the union.】

item.title: 解说员：加拿大为何即将发生史无前例的铁路停工事件
item.description: 加拿大的两大铁路公司--加拿大国家铁路公司和加拿大堪萨斯太平洋铁路公司--首次濒临同时停工的边缘，这可能造成价值数十亿美元的经济损失。【原文：For the first time, Canada's two main railway companies - Canadian National Railway and Canadian Pacific Kansas City - are on the verge of a simultaneous labor stoppage that could inflict billions of dollars' worth of economic damage.】

item.title: C.H. 罗宾逊公司从加拿大港口分流部分美国客户的货物
item.description: 美国货运代理公司罗宾逊公司（C.H. Robinson）周一表示，由于铁路罢工的威胁迫在眉睫，该公司正在将部分美国客户的海运货物从加拿大港口分流出去。【原文：U.S. freight forwarder C.H. Robinson said on Monday it was diverting some of its U.S. customers' ocean cargo away from Canadian ports as the threat of a rail strike looms.】

item.title: 渥太华表示，加拿大铁路公司和工会必须努力达成协议
item.description: 加拿大联邦劳工部长史蒂夫-麦金农（Steve MacKinnon）周一表示，加拿大两大铁路公司和卡车司机工会必须开展必要的艰苦工作，以达成劳资协议，避免全面停工。【原文：Canada's two main railway companies and the Teamsters union must do the hard work necessary to reach labor deals and avoid a full stoppage, federal Labour Minister Steve MacKinnon said on Monday.】

item.title: 纽约联储称，美国工人对薪酬和工作前景更加悲观
item.description: 纽约联储周一公布的一项调查显示，美国工人对其就业报酬越来越不满。【原文：U.S. workers are growing more sour with their employment compensation, according to a survey released on Monday by the New York Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 美国又有十个州加入诉讼，要求拆散 Live Nation-Ticketmaster
item.description: 美国司法部周一表示，又有十个州加入了司法部对 Live Nation-Ticketmaster 垄断现场音乐会行业市场的诉讼。【原文：Ten additional states have joined the U.S. Justice Department's lawsuit against Live Nation-Ticketmaster for monopolizing markets across the live concert industry, the department said on Monday.】

item.title: 声称德意志银行 "替罪羊 "的免责交易员结束诉讼
item.description: 德意志银行一名前交易员因操纵利率基准被推翻定罪，他结束了指控德意志银行诬陷他参与操纵利率基准而毁掉其银行业生涯的诉讼。【原文：A former Deutsche Bank trader whose conviction for rigging an interest rate benchmark was overturned has ended a lawsuit accusing the German bank of destroying his banking career by falsely implicating him in the scheme.】

item.title: 迪士尼任命资深制片人 Almin Karamehmedovic 为 ABC 新闻总裁
item.description: 沃尔特-迪斯尼公司周一表示，已任命资深制片人 Almin Karamehmedovic 担任美国广播公司新闻频道总裁。【原文：Walt Disney has named veteran producer Almin Karamehmedovic as president of ABC News, the television network said on Monday.】

item.title: 消息人士称，石油生产商 APA 探讨以 10 亿美元出售二叠纪资产
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士告诉路透社，APA 公司正在探索出售德克萨斯州和新墨西哥州二叠纪盆地部分地区的石油和天然气钻探资产，交易价值可能约为 10 亿美元。【原文：APA Corp is exploring the sale of oil and gas drilling properties spread across parts of the Permian basin of Texas and New Mexico, in a deal that could be valued at about $1 billion, people familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 赫伯罗特称美国客户活动推动跨大西洋航运业发展
item.description: 德国赫伯罗特公司（Hapag-Lloyd）负责人周一在一次在线新闻简报会上说，在 9 月底劳动合同到期之前的补货和急于填补库存，支撑了跨大西洋集装箱运往美国的高运量。【原文：Restocking and a rush to fill up inventories ahead of the expiry of labour contracts at the end of September are supporting high transatlantic container shipments into the United States, the head of Germany's Hapag-Lloyd said in an online news briefing on Monday.】

item.title: 伊坎与公司就美国证券交易委员会对其涉嫌信息披露失误的指控达成和解
item.description: 美国监管机构周一表示，亿万富翁投资者卡尔-伊坎（Carl Icahn）及其公司 Icahn Enterprises LP (IEP) 已就未能披露将公司证券作为数十亿美元个人贷款抵押品的指控达成和解。【原文：Billionaire investor Carl Icahn and his firm Icahn Enterprises LP (IEP) have settled charges for failing to disclose pledges of the company's securities as collateral for billions of dollars in personal loans, U.S. regulators said on Monday.】

item.title: 据 CNBC 报道，通用汽车裁减了 1,000 多名受薪软件和服务员工
item.description: 据 CNBC 周一报道，通用汽车公司将在其软件和服务部门裁员 1000 多名受薪员工。【原文：General Motors is laying off more than 1,000 salaried employees at its software and service units, CNBC reported on Monday.】

item.title: 美联储今年将三次降息 25 个季度；经济衰退可能性不大：路透社民意调查
item.description: 路透社（Reuters）调查显示，微弱多数的经济学家认为经济衰退不太可能发生，美国联邦储备委员会将在 2024 年剩余的三次会议上每次降息 25 个基点，比上个月的预测多一次。【原文：The U.S. Federal Reserve will cut interest rates by 25 basis points at each of the remaining three meetings of 2024, one more reduction than predicted last month, according to a slim majority of economists polled by Reuters who said a recession is unlikely.】

item.title: 加拿大 Couche-Tard 公司确认对日本 Seven & i 公司的收购要约
item.description: 加拿大 Alimentation Couche-Tard 公司周一证实，它已提出收购日本 Seven & i 公司的要约。【原文：Canada's Alimentation Couche-Tard confirmed on Monday it has made an offer to buy Japan's Seven & i .】

item.title: 聚焦：基金撤退，实物买家赢得铜市争夺战
item.description: 逃离铜市的投资者很可能会被冷落数月之久，这就为那些预计未来数月中国和其他地区的最大消费国需求将恶化并拖累铜价的实际参与者留下了一片净土。【原文：Investors fleeing the copper market are likely to be sidelined for many months, leaving the field clear for physical players who expect demand in top consumer China and elsewhere to deteriorate over coming months and weigh on prices.】

item.title: 雅诗兰黛长期首席执行官 Fabrizio Freda 即将退休
item.description: 雅诗兰黛（Estee Lauder）周一表示，首席执行官法布里奇奥-弗雷达（Fabrizio Freda）在领导这家美容化妆品巨头近 15 年后，决定明年退休。【原文：Estee Lauder said on Monday CEO Fabrizio Freda had decided to retire from his role next year after leading the beauty and cosmetics giant for nearly 15 years.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，美联储卡什卡利称，讨论 9 月降息是合适的
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周一报道，明尼阿波利斯联储主席尼尔-卡什卡利（Neel Kashkari）表示，由于劳动力市场疲软的可能性上升，讨论9月份下调美国利率的可能性是合适的。【原文：Minneapolis Fed President Neel Kashkari said it was appropriate to discuss potentially cutting U.S. interest rates in September because of the rising possibility of a weakening labor market, the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday.】

item.title: 聚焦：风险投资公司押注孕产妇健康
item.description: Kortny Feutardo 做了 10 年的助产士，今年 1 月她接待了马里兰州医疗补助计划的第一位病人，为新妈妈提供护理协调和咨询。【原文：After working as a doula for 10 years, Kortny Feutardo took her first Maryland Medicaid patient in January, providing the new mom with care coordination and counseling.】

item.title: 美国 杰克逊霍尔会议迫在眉睫之际，绿钞飘红
item.description: 塞缪尔-因迪克对美国和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Samuel Indyk】

item.title: 石油管道输送能力使加拿大出口免受迫在眉睫的铁路争端影响
item.description: 接近此事的人士表示，由于跨山铁路和其他输油管道的运力过剩，加拿大两大铁路公司迫在眉睫的劳资纠纷不太可能大幅减少对美国的石油出口。【原文：A looming labor dispute at Canada's two main railroads is unlikely to significantly reduce oil exports to the United States due to excess capacity on Trans Mountain and other pipelines, people close to the matter said.】

item.title: 西南航空卯足劲与埃利奥特争夺董事会席位
item.description: 美国西南航空公司（Southwest Airlines）正准备与埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）一决雌雄，争取投资者和员工的支持，以对抗这位希望全面改变公司领导层的激进投资者。【原文：Southwest Airlines is girding itself for a fight with Elliott Investment Management, rallying support from investors and employees to face down an activist investor looking for wholesale changes to company leadership.】

item.title: 美国地区性银行交易增加，贷款人旨在增强资产负债表
item.description: 作为去年银行业危机的核心，地区性贷款机构正在进行更多的交易，以巩固其资产负债表并与竞争对手竞争，从而扩大了该行业的整合浪潮，这可能会招致反垄断审查。【原文：Regional lenders at the heart of last year's banking crisis are cutting more deals to shore up their balance sheets and compete with rivals, extending a wave of consolidation in the sector that may attract anti-trust scrutiny.】

item.title: AMD 将以 49 亿美元现金和股票收购服务器制造商 ZT Systems
item.description: AMD 周一表示，计划以 49 亿美元的价格收购服务器制造商 ZT Systems，以扩大其人工智能芯片和硬件产品组合，并与英伟达（Nvidia）展开竞争。【原文：AMD on Monday said it plans to acquire server maker ZT Systems for $4.9 billion as the company seeks to expand its portfolio of artificial intelligence chips and hardware and battle Nvidia .】

item.title: 美联储在大流行病时期许下的就业优先誓言可能很快就会受到考验
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）在 COVID-19 大流行期间将解决失业问题作为更重要的优先事项，四年后的今天，他面临着对这一承诺的关键考验，因为失业率正在上升，越来越多的证据表明通胀已得到控制，而基准利率仍是四分之一世纪以来的最高水平。【原文：Four years after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell made fighting unemployment a bigger priority during the COVID-19 pandemic, he faces a pivotal test of that commitment amid rising joblessness, mounting evidence inflation is under control, and a benchmark interest rate that is still the highest in a quarter of a century.】

item.title: 对冲基金抛售飞机、火车和汽车；高盛买入能源股
item.description: 路透社周一看到的一份高盛（Goldman Sachs）报告显示，对冲基金上周以 12 月以来最快的速度抛售工业股票，同时连续第四周买入能源股票。【原文：Hedge funds sold industrial stocks at the fastest pace since December, while buying energy stocks for the fourth straight week last week, a Goldman Sachs note seen by Reuters on Monday showed.】

item.title: 期货继上周反弹后下滑；杰克逊霍尔在望
item.description: 周一，美国股指期货走低，此前华尔街创下了今年以来最好的一周，而投资者则期待着本周的重头戏--美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔在杰克逊霍尔的演讲。【原文：U.S. stock index futures edged lower on Monday after Wall Street notched up its best week of the year, while investors looked ahead to the centerpiece event of the week - Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's speech at Jackson Hole.】

item.title: 遭受贝雷尔袭击的格林纳达成为首个利用政府债券飓风条款的国家
item.description: 格林纳达已成为世界上第一个在政府债券中使用所谓飓风条款的国家--这种特殊条款允许当局在重大自然灾害发生后推迟偿还债务。【原文：Grenada has become the first country in the world to use a so-called hurricane clause in a government bond - a special feature that allows authorities to postpone debt payments in the wake of a major natural disaster.】

item.title: 摩根大通称追随趋势的对冲基金重返日本股市
item.description: 摩根大通（J.P.Morgan）分析师在一份报告中说，追随趋势的对冲基金扭转了看跌日本股市的观点，上周末开始买入日本股市。【原文：Trend-following hedge funds reversed their bearish views on Japanese stocks and started buying them late last week, J.P.Morgan analysts said in a note.】
